div1.p:
Know all men by these presents, That we
Etienne, MalbeufMalbeuf
and Manuel LisaManuel Lisa,
are held and firmly
bound unto John W ThompsonJohn W. Thompson, sheriff of the county of St LouisSt. Louis, his assigns or successors
in office, in the sum of
one hundred, dollars
currency of the United StatesUnited States, to which payment well and truely to be made, we bind our-
selves and each of us by
himself,
our and each of our heirs, executors, administrators and
assigns, firmly by these presents. Sealed with our seals and dated this 2d day of
August in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and fifteen

The condition of the above obligation is such, That if the above bound
Etienne,
Maulbouf
shall appear at the
next circuit court,
to be held at the town of St LouisSt. Louis, on the
second mon, day in october,
next to answer unto
Louis TayonTayon in,
a plea of trespass, on the Case, to the damage of the said Louis TayonTayon,
One hundred twenty, five dollars,
and if judgment be given against him at that or any subsequent term of said court, that
the said
Etienne MalbeufMalbeuf,
will pay the
aforesaid and costs, or the amount of the condemnation of the court, or surren-
der
myself,
in execution thereof, or that the said
Manuel LisaManuel, Manuel LisaLisa
will do it for him; then the above obligation to be void, else to remain in full force and
virtue in law.
div1.closer:
Signed sealed and delivered
in the presence of
Etienne, his X mark Maulbout,
Mannel Leia

opener.dateline: Territory Of MissouriMissouri, County Of St LouisSt. St LouisLouis sct.
opener.salute:
The United StatesUnited States of AmericaAmerica to Margaret Benoit, let Seraphim
Greeting:

div1.p:
You are hereby commanded
that setting aside all manner of excuse and delay you be and appear in proper
person before the judge of our circuit court on the Tenth day of April
next,
at the town of St LouisSt. Louis, then there to testify and the truth to say in a certain mat-
ter of controversy now pending in our said court, wherein Louis TayonTayon
is plaintiffs and
Etienne MalbeufMalbeuf,
defendant, on the
part of the
defendant,
and have you then there this writ.
div1.closer:
Witness
MaryMary P LeducP Leduc Clerk,
of our court at the town of St LouisSt. St LouisLouis this
27th day of
November in the year of our Lord, one thousand eight hundred and
fifteen and of the Independence of the United StatesUnited States, the
fortieth,
Clerk of St LouisSt. L. C. C.

div1.p:
You are hereby commanded to summon, Morgant Benoit St Seraphim,
that setting aside all manner of excuse and delay
she,
be and appear in proper
person before the judge of our circuit court on the fifth day of August
next
at the town of St LouisSt. St LouisLouis, then there to testify and the truth to say in a certain mat-
ter of controversy now pending in our said court, wherein Louis TayonTayon,
is plaintiff and
Etienne MalbeufMalbeuf,
defendant, on the
part of the
defendant,
and have you then there this writ.

fortieth,
